faqs.question: What are the benefits of mbas Material Management?
faqs.answer: mbas Material Management maintains complete data on all inventory. It supports multiple configurable storage structures like warehouse, location, bin, etc. This means reduced procurement cycle time and increased productivity. Drop shipment purchases and centralized and decentralized purchases are supported. Analytical reports and user-configurable dashboards for the entire procure to pay cycle provide visibility into the entire material management process.

faqs.question: What is the time frame required for mbas service to be up and running for a customer?
faqs.answer: mbas point solutions take approximately one week to ten days for the customer to have the service up and running. mbas point solutions provide both organization and business configurators. The organization configurator guides the admin user to set up organization-related global information along with user creation and security settings for users. Similarly, the business configurator helps users enter the required prerequisites. The business configurators are used to supply both the master and opening balance data which are prerequisites for the processes to run. The system provides a data uploading facility using predefined Excel templates with which master data can be migrated to the mbas application. The online help will guide users to understand the way in which the data entry is to be done.

faqs.question: How do you ensure that the data is secured in mbas?
faqs.answer: To achieve economies of scale, mbas uses "multi-tenancy". Multi-tenancy facilitates customers running their application on the same unit of software. The data is stored in one database. This makes overall system scalable, simpler and lower in cost. This may cause some to have doubts about the security and safety of data. However, any tier 4 technology data center, such as the one hosting this service, delivers complete security of data. The agreements made are legally binding and protect the business interests of all stakeholders.

faqs.question: What is "Procure to Pay" cycle in mbas Material Management?
faqs.answer: Procure to Pay is a generic term used to encompass the business cycle that starts with Purchase requisition from a buyer and ends with Purchase Invoice from the vendor. There are several pre-requisites and parameters involved within the Procure to Pay Cycle, including Purchase groups, Division, Vendor Group, Payment Terms, Delivery Mode. Purchase Return is done based on the Purchase Return Advice generated to the items, the system automatically removes the Stock once Purchase Return transaction is performed.

faqs.question: How do you ensure that my data is secure in mbas?
faqs.answer: To achieve economies of scale, mbas uses "multi-tenancy". Multi-tenancy facilitates customers running their application on the same unit of software. The data is stored in one database. This makes the overall system scalable, simpler and lower in cost. This may cause some to have doubts about the security and safety of their data. However, any tier 4 technology data center, such as the one hosting this service, delivers complete data integrity and security. The agreements made are legally binding and protect the business interests of all stakeholders.

faqs.question: What is the time frame required for an mbas service to be up and running?
faqs.answer: mbas smart solutions take approximately one week to ten days for the customer to get them up and running. mbas smart solutions come provided with an Organization and a Business configurator. The Organization Configurator guides the user/admin to set up organization-related global information along with user creation and security settings for users. The Business Configurator facilitates the entry of both master and opening balance data which are pre-requisites for the processes to run. The system is provided with an upload facility for data via pre-defined excel templates. The online help will guide users to understand exactly how to populate the data for a successful migration to the mbas application.

faqs.question: What are the benefits of the mbas Smart Trading and Distribution service?
faqs.answer: Monitors inbound and outbound logistics leading to reductions in operating costs. Distributions are enabled through inter-stock transfers. Reduces procurement cycle time and increases productivity. Simple data feeds and analytical reports for the entire order to cash cycle. Flexible payroll configuration and country specific salary sheet generation. Easy to maintain accounting with GL, AR, AP and FY closure integration across application processes and with automatic posting from other modules.

faqs.question: What added advantages does the mbas Smart Trading and Distribution solution bring to the enterprise?
faqs.answer: Trading and distribution industries around the world face challenges accessing the information located throughout the organization which is needed to strategize decision-making and enable the enterprise and their supply chain partners to implement quick solutions as well as to give the enterprise the agility to scale their operations to match demand. This requires seamless integration of all business functions and robust processes in step with the modern technology-enabled world such as those provided by the mbas Smart Trading and Distribution cloud solution. Short response time, timely information on slow-moving inventory (for optimum purchasing decisions) and maintaining optimum inventory levels (thus reducing inventory cost) are among the advantages this solution brings to the enterprise.

faqs.question: Do I need to know HTML, or do any “programming” to create my form?
faqs.answer: Not at all. We have an easy-to-use form builder that lets you create fields and give them labels. You can specify which fields are required.

faqs.question: How do I see the data that people submit to my form?
faqs.answer: Copy of each submission is also stored on our platform, so you can view your form submissions report

faqs.question: Are form submissions stored in a database?
faqs.answer: Yes, Enmothj allow you to export your form submissions as an Excel spreadsheet or a CSV file, which you can then import into another database (or open in Excel).

faqs.question: Can I edit my form after it is published?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can always make changes to your form. If you have already collected results and need to make major changes to the form, we recommend making a copy to keep the old form and its results intact. You can then change the Directory for both forms on the "Share" page to keep the form link the same.

faqs.question: What equipment do I need?
faqs.answer: Just an IP camera with an internet connection (Wire or Wireless) . The camera should use a H.264 or MJPEG codec and FTP Protocol Supported .

faqs.question: How long does it take to start streaming?
faqs.answer: It depends on the internet connection speed, camera brand, settings and stream quality. It’s usually just a few seconds.

faqs.question: What is the video resolution?
faqs.answer: You can stream in any resolution such as HD, depending on your camera. Please note that HD needs a very fast internet connection and powerful PC for your playlist. We recommend a resolution of around 720x576

faqs.question: What is the video lag time?
faqs.answer: It depends on your internet connection, camera settings and stream quality. In general, the lag time is usually 5-30 seconds.

faqs.question: Can I use WiFi camera?
faqs.answer: Yes, if it meets the requirements - h.264 codec and FTP Protocol Supported. And if the WiFi signal is strong enough.

faqs.question: Browser compatibility
faqs.answer: You Can Browse your Camera only over Internet Explorer

faqs.question: Can I watch my cameras on my phone?
faqs.answer: Sure, just install " PVMS Mobile 2.5 " app to your Android or iOS smartphone and view your cameras from anywhere.

faqs.question: Where are my video recordings stored?
faqs.answer: Video recordings are stored in STC data centers in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia.

faqs.question: What equipment do I need?
faqs.answer: Just an IP camera with an internet connection (Wire or Wireless) .

faqs.question: What are the supported internet browsers?
faqs.answer: You Can Browse your Camera only over Internet Explorer

faqs.question: Can I View my cameras on my phone?
faqs.answer: Sure, just install " PVMS Mobile 2.5 " app to your Android and/or iOS smartphone and view your cameras from anywhere.

faqs.question: Can I place my camera anywhere?
faqs.answer: It depends on Kingdom of Saudi Arabia laws and regulations. Always place the cameras with care, so that they will not be considered intrusive.

faqs.question: Can I use WiFi camera?
faqs.answer: Yes, if it meets the requirements - h.264 codec and FTP Protocol Supported. And if the WiFi signal is strong enough.

faqs.question: What is the video lag time?
faqs.answer: It depends on your internet connection, camera settings and stream quality. In general, the lag time is usually 5-30 seconds.

faqs.question: What is the video resolution?
faqs.answer: You can stream in any resolution such as HD, depending on your camera. Please note that HD needs a very fast internet connection and powerful PC for your playlist. We recommend a resolution of around 720x576

faqs.question: How long does it take to start streaming?
faqs.answer: It depends on the internet connection speed, camera brand, settings and stream quality. It’s usually just a few seconds.

en.name: Ole5
en.description:
- Ole5 is a system for tracking and managing huge amounts of internal, incoming and outgoing messages
- Ole5 Message facilitates the exchange of information and documents between two or more parties
- Ole5 is not an email system but has features that can be implemented using email
- The purpose of the system is to manage and track all incoming, outgoing and internal messages, organization of work and reduction of paper use
- It provides many reports to determine the quality and efficiency of work
- It makes it easier to search for previous messages, which increases the productivity of employees using the system

services.approval_message:
Here's some suggested revisions to the "Description" section for your consideration:

Ole5 is a system for tracking and managing huge amounts of internal, incoming and outgoing messages
Ole5 Message facilitates the exchange of information and documents between two or more parties
Ole5 is not an email system but has features that can be implemented using email
The purpose of the system is to manage and track all incoming, outgoing and internal messages, organization of work and reduction of paper use
It provides a number of reports to determine the quality and efficiency of work
It makes it easier to search for previous messages, which increases the productivity of employees using the system

**(Is there a reason why it's "Ole5" sometimes and "Ole5 Message" others? Should this be conformed? Of the latter is one part of the former, then OK.)

In the plans, the by-line under the plan name is redundant since the same information is right below it under "Features". I suggest removing it. If you want it to stay, they should be aligned. Some say "plan up to n users" but others say just "up to n users". If you keep them, start with capital letter (like it is under Features), it looks better. It would look cleaner without it the by-line. Alternatively, you could leave out the "Features" section and just put the number of users under the plan name only.

In any case, leave out the word "plan" in the first three plans like it is in the second three plans, e.g., "Up to 1000 users".

I had wanted it to be a little more enlightening about exactly what the software does. Does it generate messages itself or only track messages generated by other software, for example? Or both? But, that's your call.

Also, if you have any documentation which you could upload under "Additional Documents" like a User Manual, that might help prospective customers get a better idea of exactly what the service is to help them in their buying decision.

Feel free to call me at 0563347812 to discuss.
